articles.description: The Nifty50 closed 346 points lower at 17,530. On a weekly basis, the index corrected 1.7 per cent. It formed a bearish engulfing candle after two consecutive bullish candles, which suggests that the momentum could take a breather.
articles.content:
The Indian markets closed in the red for the third consecutive day and formed a bearish candle on the daily and weekly charts, which suggests bears could remain in control in the coming week.

articles.title: PKR downward spiral continues, falls by 96 paise against dollar in interbank - DAWN.com
articles.description: PKR closes at 236.84 per dollar; FAP chairman calls for ban on import of non-essential and luxury items.
articles.content:
The rupee, which has been declining for over a week, fell by 96 paise against the dollar during early trade in the interbank market on Friday.
